N|106|To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to clarify the exclusion from gross income for veterans' benefits.
N|106|Congressional Pay For Performance Act
N|106|Illegal Foreign Contributions Prohibition Act of 1999
N|106|To amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to prohibit political action committees from making contributions or expenditures for the purpose of influencing elections for Federal office, and for other purposes.
N|106|To amend the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to allow certain counties flexibility in spending funds.
N|106|To prohibit the export to the People's Republic of China of satellites and related items.
N|106|First-Time Homebuyer Tax Credit Act of 1999
N|106|To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow individuals a deduction for amounts paid for insurance for medical care.
N|106|To direct the Secretary of the Treasury to determine and report to Congress an appropriate tax incentive to encourage individuals other than members of the Armed Forces to participate as members of honor guards at funerals for veterans.
N|106|Hazardous Waste Recycling Tax Credit Act of 1999
N|106|Child Care Tax Credit Reform Act of 1999
N|106|Shipping Income Reform Act of 1999
N|106|To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide that an organization shall be exempt from income tax if it is created by a State to provide property and casualty insurance coverage for property for which such coverage is otherwise unavailable.
N|106|Financial Information Privacy Act of 1999
N|106|Businesses Undergoing the Glitch (BUG) Act
N|106|Family Retirement Savings Act of 1999
N|106|Family Heritage Preservation Act
N|106|Self-Employed Health Affordability Act of 1999
N|106|To repeal the Federal estate and gift taxes.
N|106|Caddie Relief Act of 1999
N|106|Capital Gains Tax Reduction Act of 1999
N|106|To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow the carryover of unused nontaxable benefits under cafeteria plans and flexible spending arrangements, and for other purposes.
N|106|To repeal the Bennett Freeze thus ending a gross treaty violation with the Navajo Nation and allowing the Navajo Nation to live in habitable dwellings and raise their living conditions, and for other purposes.
N|106|To amend the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 to require that the Director of the Congressional Budget Office and the Joint Committee on Taxation utilize dynamic scoring for provisions of bills or joint resolutions that reduce rates of taxation.
N|106|To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide that housing assistance provided under the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 shall be treated for purposes of the low-income housing credit in the same manner as comparable assistance.
N|106|Voter Empowerment Act of 1999
N|106|Economic Growth Act of 1999
N|106|Social Security Trust Funds Protection Act
N|106|To repeal the National Voter Registration Act of 1993.
N|106|To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to repeal the 1993 increase in income taxes on Social Security benefits.
N|106|To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to accelerate the phasein of the $1,000,000 exclusion from the estate and gift taxes.
N|106|To repeal the Federal estate and gift taxes.
N|106|To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to treat lands which are contiguous to a principal residence and which were farmed for 5 years before the sale of the principal residence as part of such residence.
N|106|Repealing rule XXIII of the Rules of the House of Representatives relating to the statutory limit on the public debt.
